korean: 오늘 저녁은 김치찌개 끓였는데, 생각보다 잘 됐어.
엄마 레시피 따라 했는데, 전화로 몇 번 물어보면서 했어.
돼지고기 앞다리 살로 사라고 해서, 그것도 샀어.
고기 먼저 볶는데, 기름기가 좀 나와야 맛있대.
김치 넣고 같이 볶으면 냄새가 진짜 좋아.
물 붓고 끓이는데, 거품 걷어내는 게 좀 귀찮아.
두부도 넣고 대파도 넣는데, 파가 많아야 시원해.
간 맞추는 게 제일 어려운데, 국간장 조금씩 넣어봤어.
한 번 맛보고, 또 맛보고, 계속 맛보다 보니 배불러.
끓이는 동안 밥 짓는데, 갓 지은 밥이랑 먹으면 꿀맛이야.
처음 끓인 거치고는 진짜 맛있게 나왔어, 뿌듯해.
엄마한테 사진 보냈더니 칭찬해줘서 기분 좋아.
냄비 가득 끓였는데, 며칠 먹을 수 있을 것 같아.
김치찌개는 다음 날이 더 맛있다던데, 기대돼.
english: I made kimchi stew for dinner tonight, and it turned out better than expected.
I followed my mom's recipe, asking her on the phone a few times.
She said aged kimchi is important, so I picked some out at the mart.
She told me to use pork shoulder, so I bought that too.
You stir-fry the meat first, and she said some grease has to come out for it to be tasty.
When you add kimchi and stir-fry it together, the smell is really good.
I add water and bring it to a boil, but skimming off the foam is kind of annoying.
I also add tofu and green onions, and you need lots of onions for it to be refreshing.
Seasoning is the hardest part, so I added soy sauce little by little.
I taste it once, taste it again, and keep tasting until I'm full.
While it's boiling I cook rice, and eating it with freshly cooked rice is amazing.
For my first time making it, it turned out really good, I'm proud.
I sent a picture to my mom and she complimented me, which felt good.
I made a full pot, so I think I can eat it for a few days.
They say kimchi stew tastes better the next day, so I'm looking forward to it.
